regular-title: some college application advice for you n00bs
regular-body:
clevergirlhelps:

  • do the college application early. like now. in august.
  • if you can apply early action, DO IT
  • fafsa.ed.gov, not fafsa.com
  • application fees are like $35-$50 so set a budget and only apply to the number of colleges that fit in your budget
  • try to write your essay early because the first one will be crap and you need time to revise
  • you can usually reuse paragraphs for school specific essays, because they all ask the same questions
  • actually let people read and review your college essay
  • all the colleges have: free access to a gym, people youâll like, a crap ton of clubs, guest speakers, team spirit, a lot of majors, a party scene, and ok food. donât be wowed by that
  • buy school merch after youâre admitted
  • donât worry about going in undeclared
  • take some sat subject tests in subjects that youâre good at/are relevant to your major
  • memorize your social security number
  • keep a journal of all the colleges you visit so you remember what theyâre like. and take pictures of the dorm/campus
  • donât worry at least one of your choices will take you
